what: Resources for Teaching a Workshop on Exploratory Data Analysis
title: Resources for Teaching a Workshop on Exploratory Data Analysis
text: Package {edashop} open educational resource teach workshop exploratory data analysis (EDA) using R computational notebooks. package aims combine various advantages working R statistical computing project: Ease distribution Reproducibility Availability templates computational notebooks Rigor documentation data sets computational products package designed use 5-session workshop (approximately 10 hours) teaches principles exploratory data analysis using R. package includes following components: Document templates Sessions Data sets used Sessions individual practice/research Sessions R markdown documents main contents workshop. documents resemble lecture notes, difference: literate programming documents interactive editable, means can work ways possible conventional printed notes.

what: Session 1. Basics of working with R (2 h)
title: Resources for Teaching a Workshop on Exploratory Data Analysis
text: R? Installing software: R R Studio Packages Installing packages: CRAN sources Getting help (Break) Creating project Directory structure Creating new files: types files Literate programming Data objects/classes basic operations

title: Resources for Teaching a Workshop on Exploratory Data Analysis
text: measuring things? Scales measurement Data objects revisited (Break) Quick data summaries Data manipulation {dplyr}: grammar data manipulation

what: Session 3. Exploratory data analysis I: Descriptive statistics (2 h)
title: Resources for Teaching a Workshop on Exploratory Data Analysis
text: EDA? Data summaries revisited Appropriate summary statistics scale measurement Properties data: central tendency spread (Break) Univariate description Bivariate description Multivariate description

what: Session 4. Exploratory data analysis II: Visualization techniques (2 h)
title: Resources for Teaching a Workshop on Exploratory Data Analysis
text: visualization? {ggplot2}: grammar plots Creating empty plots Mapping data aesthetics (Break) Geometric objects Univariate description Bivariate description Multivariate description

what: Session 5. A date with EDA: Bring your own data (2 h)
title: Resources for Teaching a Workshop on Exploratory Data Analysis
text: Reading external data Hands-practice additional notes working Rmarkdown

what: R: The open statistical computing project
title: Resources for Teaching a Workshop on Exploratory Data Analysis
text: R? R open-source language statistical computing. created early 1990s Ross Ihaka Robert Gentleman University Auckland, New Zealand, way provide students accessible, -cost statistical application courses. R now maintained R Development Core Team, continues developed hundreds contributors around globe. R attractive alternative software packages data analysis (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Matlab, Stata, ArcGIS) due open-source character (.e., free), flexibility, large user community. size R community means something want (instance, estimate linear regression model plot geographical information), likely someone already developed package R. good way think R core package, library optional packages can attached increase core functionality. R can downloaded free : https://CRAN.R-project.org/ R comes built-console (graphical user interface), better alternatives basic interface include Interactive Development Environments like RStudio, can also downloaded free: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ R requires work using command line, going unfamiliar many accustomed user-friendly graphical interfaces. fear. People worked long time using command line, using even cumbersome systems, punched cards early computers. Graphical user interfaces convenient, major drawback, namely inflexibility. program functions based graphical user interfaces allows hard-coded user interface. Command line, soon discover, somewhat involved, provides much flexibility operation, ability creative. begin, install R RStudio computer. video (5:23 min) shows install applications. used R previous instal, update R version 4.2.0 (2022-04-22) – “Vigorous Calisthenics”. package developed using “Vigorous Calisthenics”!

what: Auctions in a Distressed Real Estate Market in Italy: Auction Market Features. — auctions_amf
title: Auctions in a Distressed Real Estate Market in Italy: Auction Market Features. — auctions_amf
text: Data describing Real Estate (RE) distressed market, focus property foreclosures North-East Italy 2000 2016. data collected Canesi Marella means survey sent financial institutions, courts law different associations public notaries. aim survey record real estate auctions, technical socio-economic features. data provide information housing market trends performance well demographic features.

title: Auctions in a Distressed Real Estate Market in Italy: Auction Market Features. — auctions_amf
Auctions in a Distressed Real Estate Market in Italy: Auction Market Features. — auctions_amf
text: data frame 125 rows 15 variables: id Unique identifier property auctioned days_on_market Number days property stayed auctioned market sold; difference date sale (closing date) first auction starting date (opening bid) number_auctions number bidding proceedings selling discount Percentage variation first listing value (equals market value assessed appraisal) selling price premium Premium paid winner bidder win auction calculated percentage variation last listing value final selling price date Date property assessed appraisal, Year-Month-Day format

title: Auctions in a Distressed Real Estate Market in Italy: Auction Market Features. — auctions_amf
text: Canesi, Rubina, Giuliano Marella. "Data RE distressed market: Properties auctions Italy." Data Brief 18 (2018): 319-324. doi:10.1016/j.dib.2018.03.009

Auctions in a Distressed Real Estate Market in Italy: Physical Features of Property. — auctions_phy
text: data frame 125 rows 15 variables: id Unique identifier property auctioned type_class Type auctioned property; factor 7 levels (Factory, Residence, Retail, Mixed, Build-Land, Office, Agricultural Building) gross_building_area Gross Building Area (m2) quality ordinal factor describes quality property, including design work materials employed (Poor, Adequate, Fair, Good, Excellent) state_maintenance ordinal factor describes state maintenance property, new, recently renovated damaged years (Poor, Adequate, Fair, Good, Excellent)

title: IVSP - Census tracts — cntr_sp_ipvs
IVSP - Census tracts — cntr_sp_ipvs
text: simple features data frame 66,096 rows 29 variables: COD_SETOR Census tract code AGSN sector subnormal agglomeration? census tract can classified : "Não especial" (Non-subnormal), "Subnormal" (Subnormal). classification used designate favelas (slums), invasões (invaded properties), grotas (slums deep valleys), baixadas (slums low-lands), comunidades (poor communities), vilas (slums villages), ressacas (slums backwaters), mocambos (type shack) palafitas (stilt houses), among irregular settlements IPVS Indice Paulista de Vulnerabilidade Social (IPVS) group / São Paulo Social Vulnerability Index (IVPS) group. census tract can classified : "Não classificado" (classified), "Baixíssima vulnerabilidade" (Extremely low vulnerability), "Vulnerabilidade muito baixa" (low vulnerability), "Vulnerabilidade baixa" (Low vulnerability), "Vulnerabilidade média" (Medium vulnerability), "Vulnerabilidade alta" (High vulnerability), "Vulnerabilidade muito alta" (high vulnerability). v11 Private collective domiciles v12 Permanent private domiciles v13 Total improvised private domiciles v16 Proportion children aged 0-5 population v19 Per capita income permanent private domiciles v20 Proportion domiciles per capita income v21 Proportion domiciles per capita income 1/8 MW - Proxy 70 v22 Proportion domiciles per capita income 1/8 1/2 MW - Proxy 70 261 v23 Proportion domiciles per capita income 1/2 2 MW - Proxy 261 914 v24 Proportion domiciles per capita income 2 MW - Proxy 914 v25 Proportion private domiciles nominal monthly income 1/2 MW v26 Proportion private domiciles nominal monthly income 1/4 MW v27 Average age head household v28 Average income person responsible household v29 Proportion literate heads household v30 Proportion heads household aged 10 29 v40 Proportion permanent private domiciles mains water supply v41 Proportion permanent private domiciles bathroom exclusive use residents sanitary sewage sewage general rainwater network septic tank v42 Proportion permanent private domiciles garbage collected cleaning service cleaning service garbage can v43 Proportion permanent private domiciles electricity zone Rural urban code_muni Municipality code name_muni Municipality name code_district District code name_district District name code_state State code

what: Database for Industry Readiness Index 4.0. — i40_index_db
title: Database for Industry Readiness Index 4.0. — i40_index_db
text: database 101 indicators aggregated NUTS 2 statistical level. Data collected open sources Honti, Czvetko, Janos (2020). sources include data fields education (ETER, Erasmus), science (USPTO, MA-Graph, GRID), government (Eurostat) media coverage (GDELT). Indicators consider I4.0-specific domain higher education lifelong learning, innovation, technological investment, labour market technological readiness indicators. variables table input Industrial Readiness Index 4.0.

title: A qualitative survey on Ph.D. entrepreneurship in Italy. — phd_italy
text: Data survey Ph.D. (Doctor Philosophy) entrepreneurship Italy. data includes () information Ph.D. students graduate 2008 2014; (ii) background information Italian academic institutions attended students. database includes responses 906 students. Students provided information employment condition, family background opinions Ph.D. course institution attended. Information regional characteristics university policies also included.

what: A sample of Italian vineyards. — vineyards
title: A sample of Italian vineyards. — vineyards
text: simple features data frame sample vineyards Italy 2020. data describe several spatial management features random sample 3,686 vineyards distributed throughout Italy. Vineyards represented centroids, characteristics assessed means GIS-supported geospatial analysis.

title: A sample of Italian vineyards. — vineyards
A sample of Italian vineyards. — vineyards
text: data frame 3,686, rows 11 variables: id Unique ID vineyard (centroid) row_spacing Distance two rows (m) training Categories trellising pruning systems used control vine's shape. first category vertical training systems, Sylvoz, Guyot, Geneva Double Curtain (GDC) Free-cordon (FC), designated “VS”. second category (“HS”) includes horizontal training systems, Tendone, Pergola local systems. last category consists traditional Alberello training system, also known Goblet Bush vine, designated “”. lw_ratio Ratio length rows width vineyard; indicator management efficiency relates agricultural machinery transit maneuvering headland_size Width operational headland (m); sufficiently wide headlands along vineyard enable turning equipment may contribute biodiversity conservation block_shape Shape vineyar, classified regular (designated “R”) irregular (designated “”); block shape informative mechanization propensity mean_slope Average percentage inclination block relative horizontal plane max_slope Maximum percentage inclination block relative horizontal plane NAME_LATN Name region Latin script NUTS_ID NUTS-2 identifier region geometry Geometry vineyard centroids
